lexUnit.name: encircle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form a circle around; surround.

sentence.text: The city 's left bank is encircled by a Ringstrasse marked at intervals by different names and subtle differences in atmosphere .
From 1881 the helmet-plate centre featured the arms of the City of Guildford , the county town , in white metal on a brass shield which was encircled by a band inscribed : EAST SURREY .
The choir is encircled by a stone screen with an ambulatory behind .
The city would be encircled by its defensive walls pierced by town gates .
The arena itself , some 287 by 180 feet , was encircled by a wall 15 feet high .
The village , now blessedly encircled by a by-pass , was once on the main A4 , and before that , on the principal London to Bath stage route .
He shot out a lean speckled arm encircled by the hospital identity bracelet and crushed Dalgliesh 's hand .

Its design is based around a huge central medallion , encircled by 16 smaller lob-medallions , set against a field of the most intricately articulated palmettes , floral sprays and islimi spirals ( pl. 32 ) .
Hong Kong , about 14 hours flight from London , is at first sight like a futuristic Ridley Scott vision of a city , sitting encircled by treacherous mountains on the edge of China .
Egerton Grey stands in seven acres of luscious garden , encircled by walled parkland .

In 1952 Durham University had two campuses , one in the ancient cathedral city of Durham nearly encircled by the River Wear and the other twelve miles away in the industrial city of Newcastle on the River Tyne .
The startling image of a piano encircled by a wedding ring exemplifies the notion of affinities developed by Magritte from the 1930s .
This incorporates a harness anchored securely to the car , and straps encircling the carrycot .
The gold letters M O R S encircle the globe , and ultimate judgement is depicted in the heavens above where angels blow the last trumpet and Christ reigns in glory .
The Serb frontline now all but encircles Jajce and runs east just north of Travnik and turns north not far from Vitez , which will be the base for the Cheshire Regiment battalion group .
